result.execSummary:
The defendant DAVID A BOURDO was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 3 days of sentence credit.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. DAVID A BOURDO

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for DAVID A BOURDO
Current: 120 E Franklin St, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 08-01-2022)
Prior: 408 A Canal St, Princeton, WI 54968 United States

10:56 AM Defendant DAVID A BOURDO in court.  Attorney Gerise Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant was picked up on a warrant served 3 days. DA recites offer, upon plea will recommend time served and court costs. Defendant will accept. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. 

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty as charged. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by DA. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-3 days jail. Court grants the defendant 3 days of sentence credit.
-Court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Processing if not completed.

Court adjourned at 11:02 AM
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Return date on July 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.                 (Def signed in the incorrect spot)

1:27 PM Defendant DAVID A BOURDO appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Michael Kapelis appeared by video for DAVID A BOURDO.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Atty enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant on the sole count. ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Atty Kapelis makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Return Date July 18, 2022 at 10:30 AM. Court quashes warrant.
